title: The Federal Reserve’s Next Move Is as Uncertain as Ever
text:
The Federal Reserve did what was expected and lowered its key interest-rate target by one-quarter percentage point Wednesday. The real question for the markets is what’s next, and the answer seems even more uncertain than usual.

Some strategists contend robust economic readings would have justified standing pat on rates at the just-concluded two-day meeting of the Federal Open Market Committee. Others point to forward-looking financial indicators, such as the yield curve and the dollar, saying they support further rate reductions.

...
description: For now, odds favor at least one more quarter-point cut, perhaps by year end, or early in 2020.
